"More than a year back, I got the inspiration to create Physical Vending Machines to donate to charity from a church in the US. Samuel Rhee, Gregory Van and Jason Huan were and have been so supportive of this project, am very grateful to be a part of Endowus, a company with heart. 

As part of our Endowus Gives Back program, we launched this week our Giving Machines, both physical and virtual for the holiday season. With these machines, people can donate to 15 different charities that we have partnered with, instead of buying an item at a vending machines, they get to give back! It has been a tough couple years for many people. We are working with charities that help children, the elderly, families, and more.

This has been a labour of hard work and love between multiple teams.

Thanks especially to Steffie Vanessia for doing all the very hard work, and to Lean Sing Ding, Reaiah C., Jeffrey Alex Chang, Jennifer Kan, Revin Tan and more over the past few months to bring this to fruition!

We are looking to do more in the coming months and next year with some other really cool ideas and partnerships for people to give back through Endowus. Stay tuned!

The physical machines are at Velocity, United Square and KINEX as of today. They will go live at Marina Square on Nov 13. Please do take pictures with the machines and cards and tag us on social media with the hash tags #EndowusGivesBack #TheGiftofHope.

Get your friends and family down too.For those who can't make it to the malls, or want to share with friends and family and donate more online, you can do so directly at https://lnkd.in/gSthj4Ra, where we have partnered directly with NVPC - Towards a City of Good and giving.sg to get this virtual vending machine running. This virtual vending machine will also be featured on walls across 4 MRT stations come December! Please share the link on all your social media channels!

textContent:
"I had always planned to publish a book. I just didn't know what topic I should write about. üòÑ

I had spent time, money, and effort on a paranormal romance novel, and had planned to self-publish after agents and publishers had rejected my blurb. Time passed and my novel is still hidden in one of my digital folders.

Years later, I would get this message on WhatsApp 

"Just wanted to check with u if u want to co-author for #MyVoice book and write a chapter?"

I said yes.

This time, I knew what I wanted to write about. Older and, slightly, wiser, I realized what I wanted was to inspire and help others in my own way, cliche though it may be. This is why I'm driven to volunteer.

There was a bit of trepidation when I finished my chapter, because I bared a little more of my self to the world.

Will people judge me after reading my story? Probably

Will it inspire others? I do hope so

Thank you,  Neetha Sanjay for asking me. Thank you,  Neera Gupta of Global Influencers Publishing House for believing in my story.

MyVoice - Volume 4 will come out in March and will feature memoirs from women around world. Proceeds will also go to the Singapore Children's Society 

Stay tuned!

#inspirational #womenempoweringwomen #selfgrowth "

"I shared my story a lot as a speaker, but it feels surreal and exciting to share my story, in words. 
A story that has ups and downs, a story with experience and wisdom of life, a story that, I hope, inspire you.
